topic.title: Make and Receive Calls
topic.shortdesc: To make and receive calls, you need an active VoIP account from a VoIP service provider or a PBX.

section.title: Make internal calls
section.p: To place an internal call, pick up the analog phone and dial the other port’s caller ID number or dial *99 followed by the port number.

ul.li: To reach the other port with caller ID number 300, dial 300.
To reach port 2, dial *9902 to ring the phone connected to port 2.

body.section:
Make outbound calls
To make an outbound call, you need to dial according to the FXS port dial pattern. By the default dial pattern, you can dial the desired outgoing number directly.

section.title: Answer calls
section.p: To answer a call, pick up the handset as you usually do.
